channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: tech
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: tech

item.title: Cyber agencies produce ‘long overdue’ best practices for securing Microsoft Exchange Server
item.description: Cyber agencies from three countries including the US have issued a list of security best practices for protecting Microsoft Exchange Server, a venerable on-premises email server that many IT departments still cling to.
item.dc:creator: Computer World

item.title: Black vultures attack and kill cattle. Climate change is one reason they're spreading north
item.description: Black vultures have killed and eaten several calves on Tom Karr’s cattle ranch in southeastern Ohio, a loss he says didn't happen two decades ago.
item.dc:creator: Joshua A. Bickel And Melina Walling, Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: Hace falta una interrupción del servicio de AWS para priorizar la diversificación
item.description: A lo largo de lo años he advertido sobre los peligros de que las empresas dependan de un pequeño grupo de proveedores de nube dominantes, como AWS, Microsoft Azure y Google Cloud Platform.
item.dc:creator: CIO

item.title: Google, YouTube settle for $30M over allegations of collecting kids' personal data
item.description: The lawsuit alleged data was collected from children watching cartoons and nursery rhymes on YouTube.
item.dc:creator: Ben Mitchell, NewsNation

item.title: NotebookLM just got a major chat upgrade with 8x more context, better memory, and smarter responses
item.description: Google is embedding its Nano Banana AI image model into Search and NotebookLM, with Photos to follow.
item.dc:creator: Eric Hal Schwartz, TechRadar

item.title: 6 easily overlooked ways Android 16 can make your life easier
item.description: When you really stop and think about it, a new Android version is kinda like a cake: It’s filled with all sorts of different layers, textures, and toppings — and when it’s especially well-made, you find yourself encountering pleasant new nuances with every next bite.
item.dc:creator: Computer World

item.title: Apple delivers strong quarter despite trade war challenges and ongoing artificial technology issues
item.description: SAN FRANCISCO (AP) — Apple delivered financial results during its summertime quarter that exceeded analyst projections, despite being caught in the crosshairs of a global trade war at the same time the trendsetting company is scrambling to catch up to its Big Tech peers in the artificial intelligenc
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL LIEDTKE, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: This rapid SSD moves 1GB in just seconds, and offers fingerprint security - but it'll fit right in your top pocket
item.description: This compact SSD offers rapid transfers and fingerprint access, but its limited capacity and uncertain durability curb its professional potential.
item.dc:creator: Efosa Udinmwen, TechRadar

item.title: Even the most complex and advanced business VPN tools could still leave you at risk of attack - here's how to stay safe
item.description: Organizations using on-premise Cisco, Citrix, or SonicWall VPNs are at high risk of ransomware, report claims.
item.dc:creator: Wayne Williams, TechRadar

item.title: Nvidia GTC news you need to know
item.description: Nvidia showcased a variety of advances at its GTC event (GPU Technology Conference) this week – everything from quantum computing inroads to a 6G wireless stack and improved partnerships with core vendors, including Cisco.
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: Universal Music and AI song tool Udio settle lawsuit and partner on new platform, sparking backlash
item.description: LONDON (AP) — Universal Music Group and AI song generation platform Udio have settled a copyright infringement lawsuit and agreed to team up on new music creation and streaming platform, the two companies said in a joint announcement.
item.dc:creator: KELVIN CHAN, Associated Press, KRON4

item.title: Mistake-filled legal briefs show the limits of relying on AI tools at work
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Judges around the world are dealing with a growing problem: legal briefs that were generated with the help of artificial intelligence and submitted with errors such as citations to cases that don’t exist, according to attorneys and court documents.
item.dc:creator: CATHY BUSSEWITZ, Associated Press, KREX 5

item.title: Microsoft Forms cheat sheet: How to get started
item.description: Microsoft Forms is a web app that allows users to create various types of forms that gather information from people online and store that data in the cloud for review. Why is this useful? Surveys, questionnaires, and other interactive forms are a vital part of doing business.
item.dc:creator: Computer World

item.title: Cursor 2.0 adds coding model, UI for parallel agents
item.description: Anysphere has introduced Cursor 2.0, an update to the AI coding assistant that features the tool’s first coding model, called Composer, and an interface for working with many agents in parallel. Both Cursor 2.0 and Composer were introduced October 29 by the Cursor team at Anysphere.
item.dc:creator: Info World

item.title: Meta shares slide after company projects higher expenses for 2026
item.description: Meta's stock slid in after-hours trading on Wednesday after the tech giant posted strong third-quarter results but warned that its expenses will be significantly higher in 2026 than this year. Like its rivals, Meta Platforms Inc.
item.dc:creator: BARBARA ORTUTAY, Associated Press, KRON4

item.title: Google's corporate parent posts first-ever quarter with $100B in revenue in latest show of its power
item.description: SAN FRANCISCO (AP) — Google’s corporate parent on Wednesday announced its first-ever quarter with more than $100 billion in revenue, a milestone that illustrates the unwavering power of its internet empire amid legal and competitive threats. The news of Alphabet Inc.
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL LIEDTKE, Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Nvidia has started the $5 trillion club. A look at its rise, by the numbers
item.description: Nvidia on Wednesday became the first public company to reach a market capitalization of $5 trillion. The ravenous appetite for the Silicon Valley company's chips is the main reason that the company’s stock price has increased so rapidly since early 2023.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Wild Moose emerges from stealth mode with site reliability platform
item.description: Wild Moose, a startup that recently exited stealth mode, has secured $7 million in seed funding for its AI-powered site reliability engineering (SRE) platform. The platform acts as an SRE copilot, helping IT teams investigate incidents and reduce mean time to repair (MTTR).
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: Character.AI is banning minors from interacting with its chatbots
item.description: Character.AI is banning minors from using its chatbots amid growing concerns about the effects of artificial intelligence conversations on children.
item.dc:creator: BARBARA ORTUTAY, Associated Press, KREX 5

item.title: Apple Watch Series 11: The things you don’t see
item.description: While there were solid improvements in the last generation of Apple’s popular wearable, the huge 24-hour battery life in Apple Watch Series 11 means this smartwatch has finally become what it always promised to be: a device capable of running all day and all night, which is especially for tasks like
item.dc:creator: Computer World

item.title: GitHub launches Agent HQ to bring order to AI-powered coding
item.description: GitHub is taking a major step toward redefining enterprise software development with the launch of Agent HQ, a platform that lets developers manage and orchestrate multiple AI coding agents from OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, and others directly within the GitHub environment.
item.dc:creator: Info World

item.title: Stragglers from Myanmar scam center raided by army cross into Thailand as buildings are blown up
item.description: BANGKOK (AP) — The number of people fleeing from Myanmar to Thailand after Myanmar’s military shut down a major online scam center has slowed to a trickle, a Thai regional army commander said Tuesday, after more than 1,500 had left in the past week.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: It takes an AWS outage to prioritize diversification
item.description: For years, I’ve warned about the dangers of enterprises relying on a small group of dominant cloud providers such as AWS, Microsoft Azure, and Google Cloud Platform.
item.dc:creator: Info World

item.title: Anthropic draws fire from White House with AI warnings
item.description: Anthropic has been a rare voice within the artificial intelligence (AI) industry cautioning about the downsides of the technology it develops and supporting regulation — a stance that has recently drawn the ire of the Trump administration and its allies in Silicon Valley.
item.dc:creator: Julia Shapero, The Hill

item.title: OPM bringing protections for data breach victims to an end
item.description: The Office of Personnel Management transferred the current identity protection contract to GSA in September and will let it run out at the end of 2026. The post OPM bringing protections for data breach victims to an end first appeared on Federal News Network.
item.dc:creator: Jason Miller, Federal News Network

item.title: Meta AI edits your camera roll for better Facebook posts
item.description: Facebook's new Meta AI feature analyzes your camera roll photos to create polished collages automatically, but requires cloud processing and raises privacy concerns.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Teen sues AI tool maker over fake nude images
item.description: A New Jersey teenager filed a major lawsuit against AI/Robotics Venture Strategy 3 Ltd. over ClothOff, an AI tool that created fake nude images from her social media photos.
item.dc:creator: Fox News
